synopsis.text: One day, Tomoko, a young girl, embarks on a solitary journey to the Hiroshima Peace Memorial Museum to fulfill a class assignment. As she delves deeper into the harrowing history of the city, she encounters a mysterious statue that transforms into a little girl named Sadako. Tomoko learns that Sadako was only two years old when the U.S. dropped the atomic bomb on Hiroshima during WWII, and tragically passed away at the age of eleven due to radiation poisoning. Together, they embark on a poignant journey as Sadako shares her heart-wrenching experiences and the aftermath of the war, offering Tomoko a newfound perspective on the tragic events that took place many years ago.
synopsis.author: mistral.mistral-large-2402-v1:0
